concept.title: Memory Management Overview
concept.shortdesc: Provides functionality concerned with how memory is allocated for and within programs.

section.title: Purpose
section.p: Fundamental to Symbian platform programs is a concern that memory, as a limited resource, is carefully handled, particularly in the event of error conditions. For this reason, exception handling and memory management are closely tied together in the Cleanup Support API.

section.title: Architectural relationships
section.p: The Uikon framework uses these APIs to provide to each GUI program the basic infrastructure for well-behaved memory handling. In particular, each GUI program has support for cleaning up memory in exception conditions, and, in debug builds, detection of memory leaks.

section.title: Description
section.p: Functionality is provided by a number of APIs. Use them as follows:
Provides idioms to handle program exceptions, and to clean up memory when exceptions occur.
Provides low-level functionality by which a Symbian platform process can access and manipulate memory areas.
